alert.note: Alert for Clay (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 10:46AM CST until February 26 at 1:30AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Mississippi... Noxubee River At Macon affecting Noxubee County. Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee affecting Clay County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING TO LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tibbee Creek Near Tibbee. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning to late Friday night. * IMPACTS...At 23.5 feet, Flood water is covering the gravel road south of West Point that leads to the Tibbee Creek bridge near Tibbee. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 17.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 23.5 feet early Thursday afternoon. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm CST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Tibbee Creek Tibbee 23.0 17.4 Tue 9 am CST 23.1 23.5 22.7 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Forecast includes rainfall on the ground and 48 hours of additional rainfall. Additional information is available at www.water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=JAN The next statement will be issued this evening at 7 PM CST.
